formalMetadata.description: A page with an excerpt from an Arabic translation of the GNU Free Documentation License ((http://www.isocsyria.org/gfdl.html). The html element has lang and xml:lang attributes with the value "ar", the language code for Arabic and a dir attribute with the value "rtl" for right-to-left text.
formalMetadata.title: Correct lang and xml:lang attributes and text direction for content in Arabic

testElement.specReference: Specifying the language of content: the lang attribute
Specifying the direction of text and tables: the dir attribute

purpose.p: This test case is intended to pass because the default human language is correctly identified as Arabic and the text direction as right-to-left.

expertGuidance.p: This test case can be evaluated automatically when using a test tool with reliable automatic language recognition for Arabic, support for lang and xml:lang attributes, language tags, the dir attribute and text direction codes.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser can find the default human language of the document.

techComment.p: In HTML, the default text-direction is left to right, so only a right-to-left text direction needs to be identified (unless there are nested sections with different text directions).
This test case maps to technique H57: Using language attributes on the html element. Note that technique "H55: Using the dir attribute of the html element" has been removed from the May 2007 draft.

functionalOutcome.p: The browser can find the primary language and text direction of the document.

techComment.p: In HTML, the default text-direction is left to right, so only a right-to-left text direction needs to be identified (unless there are nested sections with different text directions).

This test case maps to technique H57: Using the lang attribute of the html element ((http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-WCAG20-TECHS-20060427/Overview.html#H57) and to technique H55: Using the dir attribute of the html element (http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-WCAG20-TECHS-20060427/Overview.html#H55).
